job_title: Junior IT Operational Systems Coordinator Co-op Student (2015CO-06)
job_description: Junior IT Operational Systems Coordinator (Co-op Student)Eight, 12 or 16 month term commencing May 2015Are we a right match for you?At the Calgary Airport Authority, not only will you get to be a part of developing one of Canada’s busiest airports, you will also receive competitive wages, growth through learning and development, and numerous opportunities to connect with students just like you! It is also a great opportunity to learn more about the many elements of operating a major international airport, in the midst of a $2 billion expansion. With the recent opening of Canada’s longest runway and the construction of a new international terminal, this is an exciting time to be a part of the YYC Crew.What will you be doing?As a part of our Information Technology and Telecommunications team, you will enhance your technical knowledge and skills in a unique airport environment. This role will provide exposure to the daily system operations of an international airport in the midst of a massive expansion.What will your primary responsibilities be? Manage & support Terminal and Airside Operations Systems Perform inspections and audits of Communication Rooms throughout the airport Provide ongoing support for Technology Service Requests (TSR) and coordinate the requests Audit server and networks infrastructure providing recommendations based on best practices Act as a point of contact with various departments and individuals on behalf of IT Create and update documentation including forms, manuals, processes, and procedures Assist with the coordination and management of various IT projects involving networks and airport systems
job_requirements: What will you bring to this role? Academic background in Computer Science or Information Technology with a focus on infrastructure and/or applications Enrollment in an Internship or Co-op Program at an accredited post-secondary institution Ability to work independently with minimal supervision Proficient with Microsoft Office applications including Visio and Access Entry Level Knowledge in Server and Network Systems and other industry standard IT systems Strong documentation and technical writing skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skillsNote: Students must be enrolled in a Co-op Program at an accredited post-secondary institution.Open To All Majors:No
